prefix_dialog.content: Hi there, how are you doing?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: im am under alot stress

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you like to go into the reasons you are feeling stressful?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: i feel like i am letting my students down

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: I can see how that is really tough right now. I have a daughter whose 10 so im seeing it from the other side.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I also have kids so i have the added pressure of trying to teach my own kids and teach 80 others.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I hear you on that. I would just try to keep on going, unfortunately for everyone's safety we have to make these sacrifices. Hopefully we will be able to get back on track soon.

prefix_dialog.content: Yeah even i can see that when i see my daughters class. It is a bad situation all around. The thing is though you cant focus on that or it will bleed out into your job. You have to try to stay positive and promote positivity even with how hard it can be.

prefix_dialog.content: yes but my job is the kids, turning that of me off would be turning the teacher in me off

prefix_dialog.content: Oh sorry i guess it came off wrong. I meant try not to let it overwhelm you so you can focus more on the kids.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: Yeah i know, and schools have had since march of last year to really prepare but it feels like they left everything to the last minute. I know my distract didnt even have a plan for remote until the last week of august.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes its good to just vent like this though. Get a bit of perspective.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm so confused about how to effectively teach my students online. I feel like I'm not making the right choices.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed with all the changes and challenges.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it issues a direct command ('You need to prioritize...') that removes the seeker's autonomy and tells them what to do, rather than supporting their decision-making process.

samples.situation: I cannot deal with the death of a parent. This was some years ago but still badly affects me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hello, how can i help you today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have been feeling terrible about the death of my dad. It would have been his birthday last week and that makes it even worse.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He was only in his early sixties but he suffered a number of health problems, including early onset dementia.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is rough, both for you and him. I know it's meaningless to tell you not to be sad, however, you can think that he's not in a better place

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I presume you mean now and not not ;). Though I simply am not a believer. It just made me think how meaningless life was.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: oh sorry, yyeah I mean now. Life is... fleeting isn't it? I sometimes think it's meaningless too

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do not really know what to do about my feelings. They are not going away.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I feel you, coping with losing your loved ones is never easy. In fact, it's confusing when you grieve and even when you recover and move on

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Do you think that people ever really recover from a significant bereavement?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that what you said there was very wise. Maybe it's worse, in some ways, to feel that your grief has lessened .. there is guilt that comes with that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't think people can completely get over that, you just get used to the pain of not having them around

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Whilst it hurts to think about him being dead, I think that it would hurt more if I had totally forgotten about him and did not think about him every day.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I just need you to know that whatever your feeling is, it's completely normal and you shouldn't feel guilty for having it

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It is just - very hard. I keep thinking about all the times I disagreed with him or did not appreciate him enough and I never got to tell him how much I loved him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Your dad wouldn't want to see you grieving everyday either. You should live the way you know he'd love to see

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I believe he knew you loved him regardless how much you two argued

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I don't know what to do about my feelings regarding my dad's death. It's so overwhelming.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel that way. Grief can be a heavy burden to carry.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Can you just tell me what to do? I can't decide how to cope with this.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You need to start forgetting him and move on.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it directs the seeker to take a specific action ('start forgetting him and move on'), removing their autonomy and choice in dealing with their grief.

samples.situation: I have a ton of tests and projects all due very soon and it is during a time in which I had not seen any friends and am feeling down. I feel very overwhelmed and sad.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: For example, if you have 7 classes, you can make a chart for when you will study for each of those classes and then check them off as you accomplish it, maybe not all in one day, maybe break it up in reasonable bits. Then study according to your goal, if that makes sense.

For example, if you study 3 subjects 1/2 hour each, you can go out for yogurt with a friend. So you reward yourself for sticking to that goal.
